description: Reference RAG configuration for the ContextCap EDBT paper. This file is not used for production API calls; it documents how domain-specific tools could be wired into the system.

traffic.label: Urban road traffic and weather

domain_specific_libraries.name: pandas
domain_specific_libraries.role: time-indexed aggregation and resampling of traffic and weather data

domain_specific_libraries.name: numpy
domain_specific_libraries.role: numeric operations for distributions and extreme value detection

hypothetical_external_apis.name: CityTrafficAPI
hypothetical_external_apis.role: current congestion level for specific road segments (not actually called in this prototype)

hypothetical_external_apis.name: WeatherHistoryAPI
hypothetical_external_apis.role: historical weather context to complement local sensor data (not actually called in this prototype)

prompt_hints: When the domain is 'traffic', emphasise typical commuting hours (07:00–09:00 and 16:00–18:00).
Use differences in average volume between weekdays and weekends to explain recommendations.
Explain how adverse weather (rain, snow) interacts with volume differences when relevant.

energy.label: Building energy consumption

domain_specific_libraries.name: statsmodels
domain_specific_libraries.role: seasonal decomposition of daily or hourly load curves

hypothetical_external_apis.name: TariffAPI
hypothetical_external_apis.role: electricity price time series for cost-aware insights

prompt_hints: When the domain is 'energy', use degree-days (heating/cooling) to relate weather to demand.
Highlight weekends and holidays where building usage patterns change.
